org.chronos.chronodb.api

Class DumpOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chronos.chronodb.api.DumpOption
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DumpOption.AliasOption, DumpOption.DefaultConverterOption, DumpOption.IntOption

    public abstract class DumpOption
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as a factory for options for ChronoDB.writeDump(java.io.File, DumpOption...).

    Some options (that don't need parameters) can be accessed via constants, others are produced via static factory methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DumpOption.AliasOption
      An DumpOption.AliasOption allows to register alternative (usually shorter) names for classes that appear in a dump.
      static class  DumpOption.DefaultConverterOption
      This option allows to add default ChronoConverters to a dump process.
      static class  DumpOption.IntOption
      An DumpOption.IntOption is a named container for an integer value.

    • Field Detail

      • FORCE_BINARY_ENCODING

        public static final DumpOption FORCE_BINARY_ENCODING
        Enforces binary encoding for DB entry content. Does not apply to metadata.

      • ENABLE_GZIP

        public static final DumpOption ENABLE_GZIP
        Enables G-Zipping of the output file to preserve space on disk.

        Unzipping the file will yield the internal plain text.

    • Method Detail

      • aliasHint

        public static DumpOption aliasHint(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                   java.lang.String alias)
        Creates an alias for the given class in the output format.

        Please note that this is a HINT for the output writer and input reader. It may or may not affect all occurrences.

        /!\ WARNING /!\
        You must use the same set of aliases when reading a dump as you used when writing it, otherwise the dump will not be readable! Also, alias names must not clash and must be unique!

        This has several uses:

        • It reduces the overall length of the dump by using shorter class names
        • It improves the human-readability of the dump
        • It makes the dump more resilient against package name changes (or classes moving to other packages)
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to create the alias for. Must not be null.
        alias - The alias to give to the class. must not be null.
        Returns:
        The alias option. Never null.

      • defaultConverter

        public static DumpOption defaultConverter(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                          ChronoConverter<?,?> converter)
        Registers a default converter for a given class.

        Please note that which class to use as the first argument depends on the use case:

        • When writing a dump, type must be the internal class (i.e. the parameter type of the writeToOutput method).
        • When reading a dump, type must be the serialized class (i.e. the parameter type of the readFromInput method).

        Example: 

        
 // we have a converter class like this (converts Person <-> PersonExt):
 public class PersonConverter implements ChronoConverter<Person, PersonExt> {...}

 // we write a dump using:
 DumpOption.defaultConverter(Person.class, new PersonConverter());
 // this will create a dump that contains no Person instances, but PersonExt instances.

 // ... if we want to read that dump, we use:
 DumpOption.defaultConverter(PersonExt.class, new PersonConverter());
 // this will find all PersonExt instances in the dump, and convert them to Person instances again.

        As a general rule, a ChronosExternalizable annotation on a value class will override the default converter if specified, unless they are equal, in which case the default converter takes precedence. When writing a dump using default converters, the used converters will not be part of the output.

        /!\ WARNING /!\
        You must use the same set of default converters when reading a dump as you used when writing it, otherwise the dump will not be readable!

        Parameters:
        type - The class to associate the converter with. Must not be null.
        converter - The converter to use for instances of the model class. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The option that adds the given default converter. Never null.

      • batchSize

        public static DumpOption batchSize(int batchSize)
        Sets the batch size to use when reading elements from a dump.

        Higher batch sizes consume more RAM, but are in general faster. Sensible values usually range from 1000 to 10000.

        Parameters:
        batchSize - The batch size to use. Must be greater than or equal to 1.
        Returns:
        The option that sets the batch size. Never null.
